Position Summary
The Data Scientist will provide in-depth advanced analytical insights while working in a cross-functional team environment to solve business problems. By providing critical analytics support, this person will work with the team to develop insights and analytics models to help the main stakeholders across Accumulator, Payer Intelligence, and Anomalous Activity. The role will require analytical skills and tactical responsibilities to provide insights and recommendations.
Key Responsibilities:
    • Rapidly perform exploratory data analysis, generate and test working hypotheses, and uncover interesting trends and relationships
    • Analyze and model structured data and implement algorithms to support analysis using advanced statistical and mathematical methods from statistics, data mining, econometrics, and operations research
    • Develop Custom data models and use machine learning algorithms to appropriately address business problems. Must be comfortable deploying these models into a productionable software environment and be able to iteratively optimize these models to produce better results
    • Perform Advanced analytics techniques to mine unstructured data, using methods such as document clustering, topic analysis, named entity recognition, and document classification (machine learning and natural language processing is a plus)
    • Strong understanding of large database mining tools and statistical languages utilized to efficiently build approaches and execute on analytical use cases. Specific experience with Python, R, Spark, Hadoop (MapReduce, HBASE), Hive, Pig, Java, Trifacta, H2O, or Tableau. Knowledge of relational databases and SQL is required.
    • Communicate results and educate others through reports and presentations. Maintain a growth mindset and be open to learning about new technologies and methodologies in the data science/machine learning space.

Minimum Requirements
5 years relevant experience.



Additional Knowledge & Skills

  • Strong quantitative analysis background and experience in working with large, complex data systems to aggregate, organize, and prepare data for use in business analysis
  • Strong mathematical background with strong knowledge in at least one of the following fields: statistics, data mining, statistics, operations research, econometrics, and/or information retrieval (machine learning and natural language processing is a plus)
  • Deep experience in extracting, cleaning, preparing and modeling data
  • Knowledge of the healthcare industry


Education

  • Bachelor degree in Physics, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Econometrics, or related fields
